result.execSummary:
The defendant Joe M Wall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe M Wall

defendant.name: Wall, Joe M
defendant.address: 85 N. Main St, Apt #4, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 3:50pm [mo]
Defendant Joe M Wall in court with Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 9 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--appointment/evaluation with Dr. Haggart and/or Dr. Fudala and/or any other psychologist approved by the Human Services Department within 30 days of sentencing
--participate in all therapy/treatment recommended by Dr. Haggert and/or Dr. Fudala and/or any other psychologist approved by the Human Services Department
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--no contact with Jacqueline or Richard Johnson or Randall Lorentz
--no possession of any knives, guns or other dangerous weapons
--no presence at Scottie's Eat-Mor in Fort Atkinson
--not speak in any way to Richard Johnson, Jacqueline Johnson or Randall Lorentz
--not make any gestures/ non- verbal communication with Richard Johnson, Jacqueline Johnson or Randall Lorentz
--not be on the main block in which Scottie's Eat-Mor is located
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 4:07pm

Case called at 9:32am [mo]
Defendant Joe M Wall in court with Attorney Shunette Campbell-Hunter.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Campbell-Hunter indicates that Mr. Wall has been undergoing counseling and requests a plea and sentencing. 
--no objection from DA Happ
recess: 9:37am

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 10/6/15 at 3:15pm

[MK] case called at 1:42pm. (second hearing on this date) 
Defendant Joe M Wall in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court informs Mr. Wall that the Court has granted Attorney Ricker's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel, and that new Public Defender counsel will be appointed for him.
The Court vacates its warrant authorization. 
The Court schedules the August 18th hearing, emphasizing to Mr. Wall that he must appear at that hearing.
recess 1:44pm. 

NEXT:  (1) appointment of successor PD counsel  (2) schedule Status Conference on 8/18/15 at 9:30am.
Order granting defendant's attorney's motion to withdraw as counsel

Case called at 9:46am [mo]
Attorney Joseph M Ricker appears in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joe M Wall does not appear in court

On Attorney Ricker's 7/2/15 Motion to Withdraw as Counsel:
--No objection from DA Happ
--The Court grants Atty. Ricker's motion to withdraw for the reasons outlined in the written Motion

The Court notes that prior to hearing off record Atty Ricker indicated that he has been unable to communicate with Mr. Wall via telephone and that Atty Ricker did send the Motion to Withdraw to Mr. Wall's most current address.
The Court notes that a scheduling notice was given to Mr. Wall at the last hearing and a Notice of Hearing was sent to Mr. Wall's address. 
The Court issues a bench warrant, if Mr. Wall is taken into custody he can be released on $500 cash, so long as he is given a new date and time to appear.
recess: 9:52am
Defendant's Attorneys' Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

Case called at 2:05pm [mo]
Defendant Joe M Wall in court with Attorney Joseph M Ricker.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Atty. Ricker requests to view the sealed documents of Mr. Wall's other case. specifically medical records
--DA Happ indicates that she prefers a formal motion
The Court conveys to the Parties that it will sign a stipulation on the matter

The Court calls cases 13CM457 and 14CM27 at 2:09pm; appearances remain the same
The Court orders that any sealed records in the above captioned cases that are related to Mr. Wall, be unsealed and copies provided to Atty. Ricker.
recess:2:11pm 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on June 24, 2015 at 11:20am    (2)  Status Conference on July 7, 2015 at 9:30am
Adjourned initial appearance on June 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 2:51pm. 
Defendant Joe M Wall in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Wall indicates that he went to the PD Office after the last court date, however the office was closed.  Since then he has been ill and hospitalized; he was just recently released. So he has not gone back to the PD Office as of yet.
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance.
The Court amends the Bond to add a condition that Mr. Wall is to go to the PD Office after today's hearing to make arrangements to apply for PD representation. 
recess 2:53pm. 

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on June 2nd at 2:00pm.
Courts response to defendants letter//You will have to go back when the SPD office is open
Letter from the def requesting an attorney

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on May 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:55pm. 
Defendant Joe M Wall in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. Mr. Wall waives the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Mr. Wall verifies that he heard the Court give information on right to counsel. The Court refers Mr. Wall to the PD Office to apply for representation. 

The Court requires $1,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--not to have contact with Richard Johnson
--not to engage in acts or threats of violence
--no presence at Scottie's Eat-Mor in Fort Atkinson
--not to be present on the east side of the 100 block of the Main Street sidewalk in front of Scottie's Eat-Mor
--not to be present in Scottie's Eat-Mor parking lot which is located on the East side of Sherman Avenue 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 3:08pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/5/15 at 2:00pm.
